abstract.p: Tanya E Kalivas letter on July 18 article scores Priests for Life plan to campaign against pro-choice candidates

block.p: Re ''Priests' Group Will Focus on Abortion in Campaign'' (news article, July 18):

The intentions expressed by Priests for Life in its political campaign against pro-choice candidates should enrage Americans. By referring to a woman's right to terminate her pregnancy as ''an act of violence,'' this group aims to bring us back to the days before Roe v. Wade, when a woman's only option was to risk unsafe back-alley surgery.
Re ''Priests' Group Will Focus on Abortion in Campaign'' (news article, July 18):

The intentions expressed by Priests for Life in its political campaign against pro-choice candidates should enrage Americans. By referring to a woman's right to terminate her pregnancy as ''an act of violence,'' this group aims to bring us back to the days before Roe v. Wade, when a woman's only option was to risk unsafe back-alley surgery.

Abortion is a private issue, and will, one hopes, someday cease to be a political issue. Priests for Life is attacking a matter of public health care that affects the safety and lives of all women. Its crusade against a constitutionally guaranteed right must be recognized as morally reprehensible.
TANYA E. KALIVAS New York, July 18, 2000
